text: Thomas Rajan Rose amongst the
competition and will be providing his
Reflections from the past two years but
before I invite Thomas to the stage I
would like to share a bit of his story
with you prior to HBS Thomas spent his
childhood in Dubai his undergraduate
career at Arizona State University
having earned a Bachelor of Science
degree in Finance I think it is safe to
say that Thomas has a passion for
Aviation he has worked in financial
planning for the Boeing Company Network
planning for US Airways and on an
aviation related project with McKenzie
and Company in his spare time at HBS he
has served as co-president of the
Christian fellowship and a student
leader of the 2009 portrait project
without further delay it is a privilege
to introduce Thomas Rajan as today's
student speaker please join me in
welcoming him to the
podium thank you very much de
dre Dean light Professor badco Mr
Diamond family and friends
and most importantly section
B it is an honor to be with you here
this afternoon to share a few thoughts
and a few moments with you on this very
special class Day
2009 638 days ago and just a little bit
over 6
hours we gathered together on this very
lawn to Mark A New
Beginning for for many of us it would be
the first time on the hallowed grounds
of this magical place called
Harvard for many of us it would be the
last time that we would start
school here we began drawn from all
corners of the globe collectively nearly
3,000 substantial accomplishments
shaping us to learn a few Timeless
lessons in stacking Lego bricks and
tossing tiny bean
bags
you know the MBA teaches us that one of
the most important
things is that we are to ask the right
questions and so on this day back two
years ago we asked our first
one I'm paying $150,000 for
this but uncertain of the path that lay
ahead anxious for the tasks that would
follow and eager for the relationships
that would fall form we pressed
forward over the last few weeks we've
had many reminders that our time here is
drawing to a
close friends and family starting to
arrive for
graduation the endless emails announcing
the last ever parties that would be here
hosted by our dear friends at the Latino
Americano club and the European Club
reminding us that this is the last time
ever that we would get to
tango or perhaps even the jarring
realization that the time has finally
come for us to expand our winter
wardrobes from those black section faces
that we've worn for over 2
years but as much as today seems like we
are
ending it is very much A New Beginning
as
well the path ahead still seems very
uncertain to fix things in a world where
so much seems so wrong the tasks appear
immense but building on the
relationships that we have formed and
taking joy and courage in these we are
eager still for what lies ahead to build
on the memories of this amazing and now
seemingly fleeting
experience over 500 cases later over a
thousand hours of preparation time okay
maybe over 400 hours of PR operation
parents don't worry we just got more
efficient as the years went by and
personal balance sheets that may soon
need a bailout of their
own we came away with five forces four
PS three lenses two sides to any issue
and one Unforgettable
turkey dreading those 8:40 a.m. call
calls where your brain keeps moving but
your mouth struggles to keep up
realizing that immortality awaited in
the next edition of the section Sky
Deck These are times that remind us what
the HBS experience is all
about my earliest memory of HBS was of
lunch on moving day what might have seen
as the most ordinary of gatherings even
today was anything
but Bound by the fact that each of us
had grown up in the Middle East there we
sat the four of us an Indian an Arab an
Israeli and a
Palestinian breaking bread together as
brothers and talking about hope for the
future a couple of those students would
go on to form the inaugural conference
about business of Peace in the Middle
East or more recently looking into the
eyes of Little Children Learning in a
tiny forgotten Village a little bit
outside of New Delhi India where HBS
students who had gone on the India track
had realized that no child no matter how
poor deserved a life without
education these HBS students took it
upon themselves to raise money and build
a school that today serves over 200
children in that school and in the
surrounding
areas These are times that remind us
what the HBS experience is all
about constant reminders that the world
that ushered us to this place 638 days
ago is markedly
different we are reminded that the
present economic circumstances have
impacted everyone take my
case extensive work
experience now a Harvard
MBA and a job offer in hand from a
well-known consulting
firm some might consider that I would be
a pretty reasonable catch in the Indian
arranged marriage
circles though not a
doctor as my mother often reminds
me a recent Wall Street Journal article
informed me that in these present
circumstances prospective In-laws in
India consider the term Consulting as
just another word for
unemployed you can't win corporate stock
isn't the only thing being
devalued but seriously though look
around us a number of the 900 career
Visions we came to with this place still
remain
unfulfilled constant reminders that in
the matter of a few months a decade's
worth of wealth creation was wiped away
a world that is yearning for role models
and looking to us for
Solutions These are times that remind us
what the HBS experience is all
about only a few short weeks ago we read
the last of our cases here at Harvard
Business School I know we're going to
miss all of those case protagonists
staring through Windows running through
the airports to catch a flight and yet
always interestingly having something to
drink in
hand but importantly our most
significant case study hasn't even been
written yet it is one in which each of
us will be the case
protagonist we don't know what that will
look like but it is one in which the
stakes in that case discussion are much
higher you know there are times when in
the safety of our classrooms we've
developed elegant solutions to complex
issues and we've debated them
vigorously but somehow there was always
this reassuring sense that in 80 minutes
the discussion would be over and we
could move on with our lives
the events of the last few months have
given me a new perspective of the
education that we take from this
place on a recent trip to Upstate New
York I couldn't help but overhear a
conversation among a middle-aged
couple they had worked hard all their
lives saved all that they could had very
little debt and yet were so afraid of
losing everything because of
circumstances in the economy that they
couldn't control
the only invisible hand that these
people knew left them with the feeling
of being slapped in the
face these folks would care little what
a Harvard MBA means the consequences
they were facing were
real and they wouldn't be solved in 80
minutes recent events show us that our
community has failed people like this
couple because in certain instances our
Comm Community has failed to see the
whole
picture we leave and enter a world that
is skeptical of the lessons of what we
learn in a place like
HBS that we are all about talk and
little
action but if there's one thing that we
have learned in the hundreds of
cases it's that we cannot solve problems
merely by looking at them through our
own eyes we solve problems by looking at
them Through The Eyes of others
may we hold True to this lesson as we
March toward our new beginning the time
for talking is now drawing to a close we
are being called into
action we may not have all of the
answers as soon as we leave this place
and we can't pretend to have all of the
answers but that cannot diminish our
resolve to work to find the
solution as we set out to confront these
real and daunting
challenges I would offer three pillars
upon which I would hope our class would
build its
foundation three elements adapted from a
writing inscribed centuries ago yet
remains Timeless in its
application three elements that we have
experienced in our time
together firstly
Faith a faith in the lessons we have
learned and in the tools that we have
picked up along the way a faith that we
have seen lived out time and time again
in the power of one person or a group of
individuals to make a
difference whether it is restoring sight
one operation at a time or creating
opportunity $1 at a time cases we have
read like The Arend Eye Hospital or
microf Finance
International remind us of the capacity
of individuals to change the world that
is around them in spite of repeating
failure these individuals stepped out in
a faith that sometimes goes contrary to
the
rigorous maybe perhaps not knowing
exactly how things are going to get done
but believing firmly in what needs to
get get
done secondly hope audacious as it may
be but a hope in our abilities to work
together and to find Creative Solutions
to problems as we've looked around our
classrooms and even the faces that are
represented here today we are reminded
more and more each day of our shared
Humanity it is what has taken our
classmates from the blue Ridges of the
Carolinas to the slums of Kara it is
what has taken our classmates from the
heartland of the country to the
Heartbreak of New
Orleans time and time again I am
reminded that because of the work of
those people that I met at lunch on that
first
day there may yet be chance for peace in
the Middle East in our
time all driven by the hope that we can
work together as one and the amazing
things we can accomplish when we
do and lastly
love what may at first seem out of place
in the setting is a facet I would urge
each of us to
consider the Beatles may have sung about
it and said that it's all we need and
it's true and the world desperately
needs more of
it love is patient love is kind begins
one of the most striking definitions of
love
written centuries
ago it does not envy it does not boast
it is not
proud that this would be the kind of
love that we would dare to
show imperfect as we may be we have each
been shown this love at some time in our
past even when we've deserved it
least look at those who have supported
us on this journey here many of whom are
sitting around
us we've rejoiced together as we've
welcomed little ones into our families
we've shared tears as we've Bid Farewell
to Dear ones may we never forget the
impact that it has had on us and of our
responsibility to pay it forward may we
never get so consumed with taking care
of business that we forget to take care
of those most important to
us love does not Delight an evil but
rejoices with the truth it always
protects always trusts always hopes
always
perseveres where we realize that it is
not the discovery of self that leads to
the greatest fulfillment but the giving
of self that
matters for it is with this love that we
begin to see the world a little
differently it is with this kind of love
that we start to see the world through
others eyes may we give more of
ourselves to our communities to our
workplaces to our families to bring us
to a place where love never
fails let it go forth from this place
and this time that we are a class who is
ready to serve to restore honor and
Trust once again in the professions we
enter that we refuse to accept the
status
quo you know when we graduate into the
to this
world we enter a time of Crisis without
precedent for our
generation and a world that is uncertain
of the role of management professionals
and of the responsibility of business to
society that is why as of this morning
nearly 400 of our classmates and I have
voluntarily stepped up to take a pledge
in a student Le initiative that started
only a few days ago to redefine our
responsibility as Business Leaders to
seek the greater good and lead for the
betterment of all we have taken the
first step of signing up at MBA o.org
and in a few minutes we will gather in
burden Auditorium right after the
ceremony to publicly affirm our
commitment to show that we hold
ourselves accountable to one
another this is the beginning of what we
call the MBA
oath I hope hope that you will join me
there this
afternoon this does not mean that the
decisions we take become any easier but
this time of Crisis requires a new way
of thinking a new brand of leadership
and we as graduates of the MBA class of
209 are ready to take a
stand in a similar season of
uncertainty as a fledgling experiment of
a democratic State lay in danger of
being extinguished
a mother would pen these words to her
son These are times in which a genius
would wish to live wrote Abigail Adams
to her son John Quincy Adams in January
of
1780 the wife of the second US president
and mother of the sixth US president
would be preent in her
thoughts it is not in the still calm of
life or the Repose of a Pacific state
ation that great characters are
formed great Necessities call out great
virtues nearly 230 years later at a
fragile time for this human
experiment her words still
ReSound some may regard this time in
which we graduate as just plain bad
luck where it's impossible to do
anything meaningful even with a Harvard
MBA
but let us never forget that our
greatest capacity for change isn't only
this
degree it's the hunger that's inside
each and every one of us to make a
difference in recent times of prosperity
and plenty this hunger may have
diminished but these are times that
remind us that we need that hunger more
than ever to fulfill the potential of
our fellow
citizens
maybe of those little children outside
that Village outside of New Delhi or
maybe that couple in Upstate New
York or even an entire people in one of
the most volatile regions of the
world These are times that require all
of the Innovation all of the creativity
all of the Boundless Energy that we have
seen in each other over these last two
years These are times that remind us
what the HBS experience is all
about nearly 10 years ago I lost someone
I called my best friend my mentor my
role model my
dad I would give anything for him to be
here
today in a difficult and trying
experience I came to see a lesson that
lives with me even to this
day on a plane to my father's funeral I
wondered what tomorrow would
bring it's a question I have seen in the
eyes of people all over the world over
these past 2
years in the
privilege we have been accorded to come
to learn in a place like this we leave
with the
responsibility of working to assure that
answer and Mom I know that if Dad were
here
today he would they look up and
everything's going to be all
right and so we go forward to this new
beginning the second New Century that
marks our time at
HBS I still wonder what tomorrow will
bring but in the dreams we have shared I
leave with full
Assurance we may have come here as
citizens of many nations with many
backgrounds but we leave renewed and
inextricably linked
as citizens of the
world driven by a faith in the lessons
we have learned and in a cause much
greater than any of us lifted by a hope
in our abilities to work with one
another steadied by a love that cannot
and will not fail we as a class will
stand to make the difference in this our
defining
moment These are times that expect and
deserve nothing less from each and every
one of us and this is a call that I know
we will answer thank you may God bless
you and congratulations class of
